data.title: generic extraction using function module and view
data.meta_description: hi every one , iam new to bw and can anyone plz tell me how to extract the data from R/3 to bw using generic extractor by creating function module and a view thank u,
data.text:
Magesh,

In future please create a separate thread if the question is different than the topic discussed in the thread.

Here are the steps for creating the structure.

1) Go to transaction SE11.

2) Check the radio button "data element", enter the name of the structure Z*** or Y*** and click the create button.

3) You will be prompted to selected whether it is a data element or structure or table type. Select the structure radio button and click okay.

4) Now enter all the data elements one by one that you want in the structure. If you are creating a structure using existing data elements, all the associated component type, data type length, etc will be automatically picked up and displayed by the system. If you are creating a structure with new data element, you should first create those data elements using SE11 prior to creating the structure. The process for the data eleemnt is similar as the structure.

5) Next, save, check and activate the structure. This structure can be used in any of your function module or program.

Abdul

Hi anna

start transaction RSO2 , where specifies the datasource name and choose

one from (database table , view , function module) where you have to fetch the data.

An example of a function module that meets these requirements is RSAX_BIW_GET_DATA_SIMPLE. A simple method of creating a syntactically correct module is to copy it into its own function group and to copy the top-include rows of RSAX (LRSAXTOP) function group into the top- include for this function group. Afterwards, you need to adjust the copied function module to meet your own requirements.

DataSources that are extracted generically (for example, using a view or an InfoSet) have to transfer data into interface table 'E_T_DATA'. All other DataSources transfer data into ('E_T_' + name of the extractions structures). The Service API expects the 1.2B extractor interface with 'E_T_TEXTS' from text DataSources that contain an entry in the 'internal description' field.

Kishore,

Welcome to the Forum.

The process of creating a generic extractor is same whether using a view or a function module except that the view or the function module must be existing before you can create the generic extractor via transaction RSO2.

I have a how-to document that walks you through the steps on this with an example. If you want to pass on your email id, I can send it to you.

For creating generic extractors using function modules, SAP provides several sample function modules that can be copied and changed. If you go to SE37 and type in RSAX_BIW_GET* and do a pull down, you will see the list of sample function modules that are available. Pick the one that suits your requirement and copy them under your Z***** name and change it to meet your needs. For simple data extraction, the RSAX_BIW_GET_DATA_SIMPLE works fine.

Abdul
